titlestmt.titleproper: James H. Leuba and Howard L. Gray papers 1896-1950
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: James H. Leuba and Howard L. Gray papers

bioghist.p: James H. Leuba (1868-1946) was a professor of experimental psychology at Bryn Mawr College from 1898 until his retirement in 1933. Howard L. Gray (d. 1945) was a professor of history at Bryn Mawr from 1915 to 1940.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of James Leuba and Howard Gray. Leuba's materials include research notes and notebooks, a small amount of correspondence regarding religious beliefs, and reprints of articles by Leuba and others. Gray's materials include research notes and a typed draft of The Printing of Literary Classics in the 15th Century.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
